A bug-fix update, AppCode 2023.1.4, is available for download!

This build fixes a problem with an incorrect opening of KMM projects in AppCode.

For more details, please see the release notes.

AppCode bug-fix update 2022.3.3 is here!

The main highlights include:

  • We fixed an issue that prevented AppCode from building and running applications on the simulator for Xcode 14.3 Beta (OC-23494, OC-23492).
  • Attach to Process now works as expected again (OC-23249).
  • For Kotlin Multi Platform Mobile, Gradle templates now run correctly on physical devices on M1 (KMA-613).
  • We resolved the long-standing issue that caused the screen to flicker in full-screen mode on macOS Ventura (JBR-4959).
  • The IDE no longer displays empty popups on macOS Ventura. (JBR-5258).
  • The Shelf tab doesn't disappear from the Commit tool window anymore (IDEA-305906).

For more details, please see the release notes.

AppCode bug-fix update 2022.2.6 is here!

The build includes fixes for JavaScript debugger.

AppCode 2022.1.4 is here!

The main highlights include:

Here are the highlights:
  • Fixed the issue causing text flickers in the Commit details pane.
  • Fixed the Run Git hooks checkbox in the Before Commit section of the Commit tool window.
  • Changing the .iml file no longer removes associated Git mapping.
  • Fixed the issue causing the external diff tools for directories to malfunction.

The full release notes are available here.

The new update of Aqua is out!

Aqua is a powerful new IDE for test automation.

  • Cypress Custom Commands support (AQUA-590)
    • Command detection
    • Navigation
    • Rename refactoring
    • Generation of TS declaration
    • Code inspections
    • Inlay features
  • Runners for Playwright tests with fixtures (AQUA-711)
  • Correct validation of page.locator() locator type in Playwright (AQUA-697)
  • Attribute value completion in Selenide calls for Java (AQUA-297)
  • Addressed multiple cosmetic issues, improved user experience

The new update of Aqua is out!

Aqua is a powerful new IDE for test automation.

  • Test file can be edited in Cypress run configurations [AQUA-566]
  • Cypress alias scope detect correctly when declared inside `then` method [AQUA-558]
  • Added locator injection support for `cy.contains` [AQUA-559]
  • Cypress alias detection respects declaration order [AQUA-562]
  • Playwright runner works correctly with non-standard errors [AQUA-580]
  • CSS/Xpath injections respect escaped symbols in the host string literal [AQUA-583]

The new update of Aqua is out!

Aqua is a powerful new IDE for test automation.

This update brings the long awaited Playwright and Cypress support. Tell us what you think, leave your feedback or sign up for the interview. Happy automated testing!

The preview of Aqua is out!

Aqua is a powerful new IDE for test automation.

  • Use the embedded Web Inspector to view web applications and capture page elements required for automated tests.
  • Aqua generates a unique CSS or XPath locator for the selected element and helps add it to the source code.
  • While maintaining tests, Aqua lets you verify and edit the existing locators. Validate your CSS selector or XPath with Web Inspector and check whether the locator identified the element you want.
  • As a fully-equipped IDE, Aqua recognizes page object classes and UI tests in the source code and helps verify locators with Web Inspector.
  • Aqua also helps you set up new fully configured automation projects, with a wide range of supported frameworks and technologies. It provides a New Page Object File wizard with lots of customizable templates.
  • When developing tests, Aqua auto-completes valid CSS and Xpath locators for visible elements on the current web page.
  • Aqua provides a code-driven HTTP client and helps generate requests for the given API.
  • Manage multiple databases, develop SQL scripts, and perform low-level data assertions. Aqua requires no extra tools to prepare your application data.
  • Aqua helps you develop automated tests and boosts your productivity, whether you do UI, API, or unit testing.

Read our blog post for more details.

A new CLion 2024.1 EAP build is here!

  • We've addressed an issue with CMake reloads stalling when working with the remote host toolchain.
  • Debugger:
    • CLion now shows the size of STL containers in the Debugger view.
    • The presentation of std::span and std::optional has been improved.
    • We've addressed the Null value return for children error that occurred while rendering fs::path values in the Debugger view.
  • The Assembly view is now more accurate for remote toolchains and cases with cross-compilation.
  • Numerous improvements for VCS support.

For more details, please see the blog post.

The CLion 2023.3.4 bug-fix update is here!

Here are the highlights:

  • We've addressed the issue with Clazy inspections, and now they are shown in the Editor correctly (CPP-36752).
  • We've addressed the issue with the Settings Sync functionality, and now, instead of reporting an authorization problem, the IDE prompts you to log in with your JetBrains Account (IDEA-343073).
  • Customizing inspection severities is once again accessible in Settings/Preferences | Editor | Inspections (IDEA-341773).

A bug-fix update, CLion 2022.3.3, is available for download!

The main highlights include:

  • CLion now detects the CMake errors more accurately and shows the CMake Debug hint in all necessary cases
  • We fixed the case when the IDE fails to connect to the CMake debugger
  • We fixed an issue in the Catch2 integration to support versions 3.2.1 and higher
  • We've resolved the long-standing issue that caused the screen to flicker in full-screen mode on macOS Ventura
  • The IDE no longer displays empty popups on macOS Ventura

For more details, please see the blog post.

The main highlights include:

A bug-fix update, CLion 2022.1.3, is available for download!

Here are the main highlights:

  • The Rename refactoring was fixed and is now applied to the correct code range.
  • CLion now checks for changes in the environment after every CMake reload. This way the IDE will suggest that you clean the CMake cache and reload CMake when CLion decides it's necessary.
  • Ctrl+Click (On Windows and Linux) / Cmd+Click (on macOS) in the Git Log panel now works as expected.
  • The UI issue causing a truncated VCS in-editor menu has been resolved.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2021.3.4, is available for download!

Here are the highlights:
  • Bundled LLDB on Windows was fixed to allow the debugging of Rust code
  • MSYS2 MinGW, starting with version 9.0.0.6373.5be8fcd83-2, is now supported in CLion
  • Fixed an issue with the remote SSH connection in cases where Python isn't installed on your computer or there is no python in path /usr/bin/env. This issue also caused significant performance CPU usage and a hang

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2021.2.4, is available for download!

The highlights include:

  • Fixed the Main menu so it now loads instantly.
  • Fixed the low resolution of the icons in the main menu.
  • Fixed the File mask drop-down list so it now properly displays the available masks.
  • Fixed the IDE's behavior when switching between Git branches - unexpected empty windows no longer appear.
  • Fixed a regression when opening a CMake project without an .idea folder in it.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2021.1.3, is available for download!

The highlights include:

  • Fixed red CUDA code with Visual Studio C++ toolchain.
  • Fixed the code completion in CUDA code that stopped working after including a normal C++ header file (*.h) to the CUDA files.
  • Fixed the incorrect error Use of undeclared identificator __cudaPushCallConfiguration.
  • CLion no longer shows update notifications from disabled plugins.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2020.3.4, is available for download!

A bug-fix update, CLion 2020.1.3, is available for download!

A bug-fix update, CLion 2019.3.6, is available for download!

Here are the key highlights:

CLion 1.1.2, a security update, is now available.

IMPORTANT: This free update contains important security fixes and is strongly recommended for all users.
For more details please read this blog post.

Simplification of sessions

Over the last few years, we've received tons of feedback from users who say that they don't understand the concept of sessions and that this functionality has contributed significantly to DataGrip's learning curve. Here are several examples:

  • The project-first and separate-console-session model is way over the top overkill. This model makes opening and executing a simple SQL file a real chore. If I just want to open and execute a script I have to first create a project, then add the file to the project, then open a console, then open a session, and then attach the file to the session. What a gigantic PAIN.
  • Coming from SQL Server Management Studio, DataGrip's UI is a lot more complex. In SSMS you basically just have servers, queries and results. In DataGrip there's sessions and consoles and scratch files, etc., etc., making the tool much less intuitive for new users.
  • Some of the way the UI works is clunky and non-obvious. When I have to select a console to run a script on, it's not entirely clear to me why I have to do this or what the ramifications of the selection are. This shouldn't really be the default behavior.

In DataGrip, "session" is a technical term that refers to the container for a connection. In other words, connections can be established, stopped, and re-established within one session. For each connection, there is one session.
The ability to attach sessions is a powerful mechanism, but in the majority of cases, users just need to set the context (data source and database or schema) for the queries to be run.
Starting from version 2024.1, users will no longer need to manually choose which session to run queries in, and this will be the case for all types of queries. Sessions are still there under the hood, but you won't need to worry about them.
Let's take a deep dive into how this change affects DataGrip's main use cases.

Attaching and switching data sources

To attach a file, you now simply need to select the data source, rather than the session. After selecting the data source, you choose the schema.

Switching sessions

The Switch Session action now only appears in the client context menu in the Services tool window. It allows you to switch the session only within the current data source.

Running functions

You no longer need to select a session before launching a function. In the function launch window, a Run From option allows you to select the console or file from which the function will be launched.

Record view

You can now focus on one record in the data editor. To open a record view, use the shortcut Ctrl/Cmd+Shift+Enter or the Show Record View button on the toolbar:

A record view will open in the side panel, where the value editor and aggregate view are located:

The cells in record view are editable if they are editable in the main grid.

Code completion: custom symbols to accept suggestions

We've added to specify which symbols you will use to accept code completion suggestions, allowing you to write SQL even faster.
To make this work, you need to enable two options.
This one:

And this one:

This feature can be especially useful when using operators:
DataGrip 2023.3.4 is Out!
DataGrip 2023.2.3 is Out!

DataGrip 2023.1.2 is Out!

Improvements:

  • Several bugs in the SQL formatter have been fixed.
  • DBE-16982 A memory leak that occurred when exporting data to a file has been fixed.
  • DBE-17820 Add/Clone/Delete Column menu items no longer disappear when editing a CSV file in table mode.
  • DBE-18003 The source text is now generated correctly in the Create view dialog.
  • DBE-17929 Node disabling for SQL resolution scopes now works correctly.
  • DBE-17898 [PostgreSQL] PostgreSQL 16 detection has been fixed.
  • DBE-17796[SQLite] Partial index generation has been fixed.
  • DBE-17783 [Azure SQL Database] The default browser now opens as expected when connecting.
  • DBE-15989 [Redshift] External schemas are now clearly distinguished on the Schemas tab in data source properties.
  • DBE-17813 [MySQL] Explain plan submenus are displayed correctly for MySQL Aurora.
  • DBE-17846 [MySQL] Duplicated collations have been removed from DDL types.
  • DBE-16995 [Snowflake] The LIKE ALL operator is now supported.
  • DBE-17916 [Snowflake] New aggregate functions are now supported.
  • DBE-17261 [Snowflake] The functions MIN_BY and MAX_BY are now supported.
  • DBE-17833 [Snowflake] We've added support for string literals as a body for Snowflake Scripting procedures.
  • DBE-17912 [Snowflake] Highlighting for Python user-defined functions has been fixed.

DataGrip 2022.3.3 is Out!

Improvements and bug fixes

  • DBE-11963: Auto-refresh is now available with adjustable intervals. It can be disabled manually or automatically (for example, if you start editing).

    You can set up auto-refresh for sessions in Virtual views to monitor sessions in real time, which finally resolves this really old ticket, DBE-229

  • DBE-17059: A list of settings was added to the Object Migration dialog.

  • DBE-16936: The Custom color chooser for databases now works correctly.
  • DBE-17068: Execute to file now works correctly.
  • DBE-16902: [Redis] We fixed the problem with connecting when SSL is enabled. Important: Please update the Redis JDBC driver to v1.3.
  • [Oracle] We added more details related to obtaining stored object sources to the Diagnostic Refresh log. This will help us investigate problems when some object sources are not retrieved by the introspector properly.

DataGrip 2022.2.5 is Out!

Bug-fixes

  • DBE-16324: Fixed the Datagrip freezing issue that occurred due to INSERT AS SELECT queries.
  • DBE-12680: Database renaming now works correctly.
  • DBE-16462 [PostgreSQL]: Fixed the bug with incorrect max values for BIGINT identity columns.
  • DBE-15560 [Microsoft SQL Server]: INCLUDE columns are now recognized correctly.
  • DBE-16377 [PostgreSQL]: Fixed the issue with extra grant/revoke permissions.
  • DBE-15604 [Snowflake, BigQuery]: QUALIFY clause is now supported.
  • DBE-16203 [BigQuery]: Database introspection now works correctly.
  • DBE-16376 [Amazon Aurora SQL]: Many users have encountered issues when using the MariaDB 3.X driver due to a known MariaDB Connector bug. If you are still facing this problem, downgrade the driver version manually by selecting MariaDB Connector J / 2.X in the Driver Files. You may also need to restart the IDE.

DataGrip 2022.1.5 is Out!

Bug-fixes

  • DBE-14378: TiDB is now detected, and DataGrip only uses statements that are supported by the database.
  • DBE-15553: [Exasol] The IMPERSONATE command is now supported.
  • DBE-15322: [ClickHouse] Fixed type deduction for map literals.
  • [Snowflake] Added the ability to skip the table stage property introspection if it's taking too long to get the properties.
  • [PostgreSQL, Azure] Fixed the introspection problem that was occurring when several databases were selected in one data source (also fixed DBE-15360).
  • [Oracle]: Fixed Numeric Overflow in Oracle v.18 and later.

DataGrip 2021.3.4 is Out!

Fixes

  • DBE-14416 [PostgreSQL, Greenplum, Redshift]: The introspector is now more stable if errors occur.
  • DBE-10913 Synonym quick info now displays information about the target object.
  • DBE-14724 The console toolbar disappears automatically after session detach for non-SQL files.
  • DBE-11591 [PostgreSQL]: DataGrip will automatically re-run queries without CTID if it causes an error in Postgres Citus.
  • DBE-14728 [Azure] Fixed Copy Table to... when the action is invoked from the context menu or from Find Action.
  • DBE-14697 After executing the migration script, DataGrip automatically refreshes the target schema.
  • DBE-14633 The Oracle debugger now works as expected.

DataGrip 2021.2.4 is Out!

Fixes

  • DBE-13839: Directories are now attached correctly.
  • DBE-14149: [Oracle] The Driver class 'Files' not found warning is no longer falsely triggered when connecting via TNS.
  • DBE-14144: [Oracle] Fixed the bug that occurred when trying to alter a table that contained a partitioned table with an "update indexes" expression.
  • DBE-12195: [Vertica] The LIMIT OVER syntax is now supported.
  • DBE-14120: [PostgreSQL] Custom search paths inside routine definitions are now supported.

DataGrip 2021.1.3

Fixes

  • DBE-13313: Fixed the "handshake error" problem when connecting to the database.
  • DBE-13287: Code completion now works in the Modify Table even if the case doesn't match.
  • DBE-13292: [SQL Server] Extended properties are not included in the generated DDL.
  • DBE-13350: [Oracle] Introspection is compatible with version 9i.

DataGrip 2020.3.2 is Out!

Important fixes

  • DBE-12398: The problem with freezes on Test Connection is fixed.
  • DBE-12367: Athena introspection works again.
  • DBE-12168: The Submit changes immediately option is back.
  • DBE-10828: The JDBC URL is not pasted in the data source name by default.

DataGrip 2020.2.3

Important fixes:

  • DBE-11340: The username and password fields no longer disappear.
  • DBE-11156: When updating the source code, if a new version contains errors and fails to be submitted, you'll now see a prompt to restore the previous version.
  • DBE-11440: [SQL Server] Submit changes to database works again for procedures.

DataGrip 2020.1.5

Most important

  • The issue with SQL Server Authentication on Windows is fixed.

Other fixes

  • DBE-9876: Forced execution in read-only mode now runs the correct query.
  • DBE-10727: Schemas comparator respects column order.
  • DBE-10715: [PostgreSQL]: DataGrip no longer throws a time zone error for versions of PostgreSQL before 10.
  • DBE-10724: [Snowflake]: The Modify Table dialog generates valid code.

New features

  • A new quick-fix is available: Refresh schema.
  • The migration buttons now tell clearer what they actually do.
  • If you create a DDL data source, the folder with the sources will automatically be attached to the project.
  • If you try to change the DDL of the target table during the data import process, DataGrip will warn you.
  • If an Oracle database wants you to change an expired password, you can do so from the UI.

DataGrip 2019.3.5 is Out!

Important bug fixes:

  • IDEA-238386, IDEA-236342, IDEA-219779: Fixed problems with licensing.
  • DBE-10396: Errors no longer occur while creating object files in SQL Generator.
  • DBE-10371: Opening an SQL file from Explorer no longer creates a new project.

DataGrip 2019.2.6 is Out!

  • Result tabs switch with the consoles again.
  • No more freezes on MacOS Catalina when exporting data. DBE-9334
  • Fixed the bugs with the external tables in Redshift not showing. DBE-9181
  • Various bugs with paging are fixed. DBE-9217
  • Column names are no longer collapsed when the data editor is transposed. DBE-8904
  • The "column specified more than once" error does not appear for data import anymore. DBE-9283
  • The table and column comments are not truncated anymore. DBE-8000
  • There are no longer false warnings about the number of values when selecting the identity column. DBE-8924

DataGrip 2019.1.4 is Out!

Bug fixes

  • We hope that, finally, all the performance problems on startup are fixed! JBR-1393
  • The Filter History is preserved in the data editor after a restart DBE-8318
  • Boolean values can be edited when creating a new row DBE-7701
  • [Oracle] DataGrip doesn't hang when working with big packages DBE-8499
  • [Apache Ignite] Data editor now works DBE-8453

DataGrip 2018.3.4 is Out! Some bug-fixes are inside.

SQL formatter: we're still improving it!

  • DBE-4805: We keep the case of quoted identifiers in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-6937: Better arrays formatting in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-7362: Formatter works in SQL-injections.
  • DBE-7376: Better WITH formatting.
  • DBE-7605: Support for INTO TEMP TABLE in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-7806: Better formatting for variables in SQL Server.
  • DBE-7881: Support for ON CONFLICT clause in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-7890: No more line break after PERFORM in PostgreSQL.

Other

  • During data import errors are written into a file by default.
  • DBE-7838: Fixed bug with missed reference when creating a foreign key.
  • DBE-7840: Autoscroll from the editor works correctly.
  • DBE-7896: No more raw HTML in notifications.

GoLand 2024.1 Beta is now available!

The Beta version includes all of the new features and improvements from our current EAP cycle that are expected to appear in the upcoming 2024.1 release:

AI features:
  • Full line completion
  • Cloud-based completion for structs and interfaces
  • Documentation generation for fields
Support for Go 1.22:
  • Support for range for integers and functions
  • Vendoring support for Go workspaces
Performance improvements:
  • More highlighting while indexing
  • Improved indexing performance
UX and technologies support
  • Data flow analysis update
  • New terminal
  • Option to scale down the entire IDE
  • Updated product icons

Please see the blog post for more details or the release notes for the complete list of fixes and improvements.

GoLand 2021.1.3 is here!

IntelliJ IDEA 2023.3.4 is out with the following updates:

IntelliJ IDEA 2022.3.3 is out!
  • We've resolved the long-standing issue that caused the screen to flicker in full-screen mode on macOS Ventura. [JBR-4959]
  • The IDE no longer displays empty popups on macOS. [JBR-5258]
  • The Shelf tab doesn't disappear from the Commit tool window anymore. [IDEA-305906]
  • The Check RegExp action no longer results in a false Bad regular expression pattern alert. [IDEA-261269]
  • The IDE correctly saves the set Docker WSL distribution option. [IDEA-305901]
  • Attaching folders created outside the IDE via File | Open now works as expected. [IDEA-311278]
  • It's now possible to check the configuration status of Windows Defender and update it directly from the IDE. To do so, search for Check Windows Defender Status in Find Action (⇧⌘A/Ctrl+Shift+A). [IDEA-310423]
For more details, refer to this blog post.

PhpStorm 2024.1 Beta is now available

This build brings a bunch of bug fixes and quality-of-life improvements.


Here are the most notable changes and bug fixes in this build:

  • Fix: XDebug / PHPStorm Step Debugging - modified values aren't detected [WI-75372]
  • Fix: Autocomplete showing duplicate methods if class implements interface [WI-72549]
  • Fix: Feature test gutter icons automatically assume Behat configuration even if Codeception is enabled [WI-73166]
  • Fix: Use symfony console to install importmap module via quick-fix [WI-76170]
  • Fix: Rename "Project from Version Control" action in the Project Widget [WI-76392]
  • Fix: Module isn't installed in importmap: title contains injected value [WI-76389]
  • Fix: Module isn't installed in importmap: Inspection is placed under wrong group [WI-76388]
  • Fix: Pest plugin doesn't get published on Marketplace anymore so IDEA users can't update it [WI-76382]
  • Fix: Pest Inspections: change naming from 'must' to 'should' [WI-76369]
  • Fix: Convert intention to run importmap:require to inspection [WI-76172]
  • Fix: Import of js module in subproject is highlighted as not installed even if it is present in importmap.php [WI-76167]
  • Fix: Deployment: Freeze on batch apply of changes in diff dialog [WI-75812]
  • New: Pest: Add Go To "method -> test" and "test -> method" [WI-75699]
  • Fix: Deployment: Exception after uploading same file to remote host twice [WI-75226]
  • Fix: Pest plugin: Type of $this in Pest test is inferred wrong in subproject [WI-75198]
  • Fix: Type of $this in closure in Pest test should be resolved to target Pest test class [WI-75120]
  • Fix: Symlink files/folders are not shown in the UI as being linked (New UI) [IDEA-295555]
  • Fix: Pressing Ctrl+tab causes an exception. java.lang.AssertionError: Can't create key stroke for control 36 [IDEA-270009]
  • Fix: IllegalArgumentException at ChildInfoImpl.<init> [IDEA-259257]

The full list of changes in PhpStorm 2024.1 Beta is available in the release notes.

Notable changes:

  • Added: Run query periodically [DBE-11963]

PyCharm 2022.3.3 is out!

Here are the latest updates:

PyCharm 2022.2.5 is now out, with the following notable fixes:

  • The IDE no longer displays empty popups on macOS Ventura. [JBR-5258]
  • We've resolved the issue that caused the screen to flicker in full-screen mode on macOS Ventura. [JBR-4959]

PyCharm 2022.1.4 is available

  • Fixed the bug that was causing the IDE to crash after the upgrade to 2022.1.3 on macOS High Sierra.
  • Fixed the issue with local module recognition in the Terraform plugin.
  • Fixed the Run Git hooks checkbox in the Before Commit section of the Commit tool window.
  • Changing the .iml file no longer removes associated Git mapping.

PyCharm 2021.3.3 is available

This update release includes the following improvements:

  • Code insight: Generic types are now fully supported. [PY-29257]
  • Code insight: Whitespace checks for variables starting with 'match' and 'case' no longer raise false positives. [PY-51141]
  • Code insight: Bundled pycodestyle has been updated to version 2.8.0. [PY-51269]
  • Docker: A Docker Compose interpreter is now created successfully. [PY-50932]
  • macOS: Python 2–based venv can now be created through PyCharm for the M1 processor. [PY-46430]

Read the release notes for all the fixes.

Found a bug? Please report it using our bug tracker.

PyCharm 2021.2.4 is out!

  • We fixed a bug that made PyCharm repeatedly activate conda environments during inspections. [PY-51096]
  • We fixed a bug that prevented connections made through a proxy server with authentication to work. [IDEA-276949]
  • We fixed a bug that made cloning from Git fail. [IDEA-282605]
  • We fixed a bug that made the main menu slow to build. [IDEA-277709]
  • We fixed a bug with icons in the main menu. [IDEA-283733]

Read the release notes to check out all the fixes.

PyCharm 2021.1.3 is out!

Here are the fixes we worked on:

  • Fixed the problems behind several UI freezes. [JBR-2755]
  • Fixed the infinite indexing issue. [IDEA-266989]
  • User interface: Ctrl+Shift+Arrow shortcut selects text in a dialog window rather than stretching the window. [IDEA-267294]
  • It is now possible to work with KWallet without errors. [IDEA-261634]
  • Quick documentation: .jpeg and .svg images are rendered correctly. [IDEA-256001]
  • Plugins: disabled plugins that have been updated to the latest version don't cause a false notification saying a plugin update is required. [IDEA-267878]
  • VCS: Fixed an unexpected closure of the "Compare branch" dialog. [IDEA-251381]
  • Projector: PyCharm doesn't crash on restart when Projector is used. [IDEA-269591]
  • Python Console: "Run Cell and Select Below" shortcut (Ctrl+Enter) in SciView now moves the caret to the next cell after execution. [PY-48157]
  • Django: Code Completion for Django Models now works correctly. [PY-48252]
  • Debugger: when the "Attach to Node.js/Chrome" Run/Debug configuration is used, the debugger reconnects automatically upon node restart. [WEB-50455]
  • Databases: code completion for table synonyms works correctly for databases in MS SQL. [DBE-4531]

Read the blogpost and the release notes to check out all the changes.

Found a bug? Please report it using our bug tracker.

PyCharm 2019.3.5 release is available for download!

This version fixes bugs and improves your experience while performing some core tasks.

  • Fixed a bug that printed an unexpected output when debugging in remote environments
  • Fixed a bug that prevented users to generate files from the SQL Generator
  • For SVN users, we fixed a bug that prevented PyCharm to request user's permission to delete files from SVN
  • If you work with Angular, we fixed a bug where the inspector incorrectly reported a missing declaration warning

For more details and the full list of fixes read our release notes

    • Fixed exception caused by having default non-English locale.

Rider 2024.1 EAP 8 comes with the following updates:

Code With Me

After much anticipation, preliminary Code With Me support has finally been added to Rider! To enable it, go to Tools | Enable Code With Me. Please share your feedback with us by commenting on the corresponding YouTrack issue!

Blazor support

You can now generate additional files like .razor.cs, .razor.css, .razor.js on generating a Blazor Component file template.

Refactorings

We’ve made several improvements to the Change Signature refactoring. For more details, refer to the ReSharper page.

Unity support

We’ve dropped the extended support for Unity versions predating 2019.2. This means Rider no longer offers features related to Unity Editor integration.

For the full list of changes included in this build, please refer to the issue tracker.

Rider 2023.3.3 is out with the following fixes:

  • MAUI projects can once again be deployed to physical iOS devices. [RIDER-76794]
  • The Export to file action works correctly for type dependency diagrams. [RIDER-103400]
  • Text in the Editor window no longer freezes when being scrolled. [RIDER-103794]
  • Xamarin.Android Designer now works as intended. [RIDER-99102]
  • Rename works correctly for references between files in Rider 2023.3. [RSRP-495217]
  • Abbreviations are no longer falsely flagged as spelling mistakes. [RSRP-495107]
  • String length checks for Entity Framework entities no longer generate incorrect hints when MaxLength is set by static and constant values. [RSRP-495160]
  • Primary constructor attribute inheritance no longer triggers false positive warnings. [RSRP-495253]
  • The IDE's suggestion to dispose of the IEnumerator GetEnumerator() was retained, while the corresponding quick-fixes were adjusted. See this comment for details. [RSRP-494839]
  • Error executing shell command pm list packages no longer occurs when attempting to debug on a physical Android 13 device. [RIDER-81549]
  • The IDE no longer sends erroneous update notifications for disabled plugins. [IDEA-273418]
  • Marking GitHub pull request files as "reviewed" works as expected. [IDEA-338906]
  • The search functionality in the Emoji & Symbols popup dialog works on Linux. [IDEA-327171]
  • The IDE correctly displays the chosen file in the Commit dialog when executing the Commit File action for one of the modified files. [IDEA-336983]

For the full list of resolved issues, please refer to our issue tracker.
Rider 2023.2.4 is out! This bug-fix update brings fixes and improvements to strengthen the IDE's overall stability.

Rider 2023.1.4 is out with the following fixes:

  • We fixed the issue with missing custom code style settings – they are now correctly preserved by the IDE. [IDEA-318457]
  • The Copy Reference action for files in non-Java modules works as expected and copies the path from the content root. [IDEA-316752]
  • Starting up the IDE no longer fails with the "CannotActivateException: Address already in use: bind" error. [IDEA-323836]

The build comes with the following bug fixes:

  • We've resolved the issue that caused the screen to flicker in full-screen mode on macOS Ventura (JBR-4959).
  • The IDE no longer displays empty popups on macOS Ventura (JBR-5258).

The Rider 2022.2.4 bug-fix release has just arrived. Let's take a look at the most important updates.

  • Fixed the CVE 2022-41032 vulnerability Microsoft recently uncovered in .NET 7.0.0-rc.1, .NET 6.0, .NET Core 3.1, and NuGet clients (NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, and NuGet.Protocol).
  • Fixed an error that was preventing Rider from building projects that target Unreal Engine 5.1 Preview on macOS (RIDER-83762).
  • Fixed an error causing Rider to interfere with the processing of T4 text templates in Microsoft Visual Studio (RIDER-80838).

For the full list of fixes, please refer to our issue tracker.

• We fixed the Windows Authentication for the SQL Server (DBE-15456)
  • We fixed the metadata for the Unity plugin – the plugin DLL no longer returns errors (RIDER-76619).
Rider 2021.3.4 is a technical release due to our release pipeline keeping the same versioning as the ReSharper 2021.3.4 release.

Please welcome Rider 2021.2.3!

  • We've fixed the double "Untrusted solution..." security notification.

  • We've fixed the performance lags and crashes that would occur while building the main menu.

We've introduced the concept of trusted projects to mitigate the risks associated with opening projects from unknown and untrusted sources. This blog post has the details.

Rider for Unreal Engine 2022.1 preview build is here!

Here are the highlights:

  • Unreal Engine
    • Support for Unreal Engine unit testing is now enabled on macOS and Linux.
    • You can now open the engine without a game project (or with several projects) in Rider. Just select the Unreal Engine root folder or the UE4Games.uprojectdirs file when choosing a project to open.
    • We added support for reloading dependent modules when the .Build.cs file has been changed and the project is opened via .uproject file (RIDER-63077).
    • We reduced the load time of the project properties window. Now only the selected configuration tab's content is loaded (RIDER-36014).
    • We added support for Unreal Engine 5 built-in preprocessor macros in the .Build.cs and .Target.cs files (RIDER-45134).
    • Rider no longer suggests C# features that are too modern in the .Build.cs and .Target.cs files on Unreal Engine 4 (RIDER-72371).
    • Rider now reads the list of valid reflection specifiers directly from the currently used version of Unreal Engine, so it offers you only applicable items in code completion and shows up-to-date documentation.
  • UnrealLink/RiderLink
    • The Refresh project action is available on the toolbar to regenerate Visual Studio project files (only for .sln).
    • New actions Extract RiderLink plugin to Game and Extract RiderLink plugin to Engine are now available via Find Actions and the File | Settings | Languages & Frameworks | Unreal Engine menu. If RiderLink fails to build, or if you don't want to build RiderLink right away, you can use Extract RiderLink, which will skip the compilation of RiderLink and will simply extract its source code into your project.
    • We implemented several Unreal log panel fixes and UX improvements (RIDER-68827).
  • Debugger
    • Fixed a variety of issues causing crashes.
    • Fixed reading PDB files from network paths.
    • Fixed global hex presentation on Windows

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2021.3.1 update is here!

While we planned for Rider for Unreal Engine 2021.3 to be the last separate build for Unreal Engine development, we decided to publish a new bug-fix update to address a few critical UI freezes reported by our users. This includes the following fixes:

  • Memory consumption on the frontend no longer leads to UI freezes:
    • During code highlighting (RIDER-7297).
    • During code navigation (RIDER-72539).
    • While displaying code hints (RIDER-72698).
    • In other cases (RIDER-73194).
  • Unreal Engine support:
    • Numerous fixes for Blueprint parsing.
    • Fixed Rider showing successfully passed unit tests as failed in UE5.
    • Unreal log filter configuration is now preserved between launches, and other fixes for the UnrealLink/RiderLink pair of plugins.

What's coming next? The Rider 2022.1 EAP will include Unreal Engine support merged from Rider for Unreal Engine.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2021.2.1 update is here!

The highlights include:

  • Unreal Engine Automation Testing framework support. Read our blog post for more details, known limitations, etc.
  • .uproject model support:
    • Rider now adds new files to the .uproject project model when they are created on the disk.
    • Rider no longer fails when opening .uproject in a clean project with a relative path to the engine (RIDER-61964).
    • Fixed issues with loading .uproject on macOS (RIDER-66436).
    • Fixed issues with calling UnrealBuildTool from Rider (RIDER-66160).
  • Debugger enhancements:
    • Fixed several issues leading to extremely high memory consumption (RIDER-67064).
    • On macOS pretty printers are now imported automatically (RIDER-66212).

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2021.1.3 update is here!

This update brings more fixes for Unreal Engine 5 projects and unveils our debugger overhaul, which significantly improves the way variables are rendered in the debugger.

  • Improved Natvis support
    • Support for Inheritable attribute, format specifiers, CustomListItems.
    • Better built-in renderers.
  • A fix for the incorrect rendering of the tuple collection (especially critical for the TTuple, TVariant, and TArray types with non-standard allocators).
  • Fixes for Unreal Engine 5.

Read on for more details in our blog.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2020.3.4 update is here!

This build comes with a hotfix for the problem causing the debugger to crash on applications built with FASTBuild. The issue has been eliminated, and you can now successfully debug such apps in Rider.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2020.2.2 update is here!

Here are the highlights:

  • In UnrealLink/RiderLink plugin:
    • The plugin is now hosted on JetBrains Marketplace,
      so we can now update it independently from the Rider for Unreal Engine release cycle.
    • Fixed build issues for UE 4.23 and earlier.
    • Fixed UI freezes when there are too many messages in the Unreal log panel.
  • In general C++ support:
    • Fixed an issue with the Switch Header/Source action
      sometimes not working properly when a preview panel is open.
    • Fixed an issue with the Go to file member action
      which behaves incorrectly in UE sources when Treat Unreal Engine symbols as non-project is on.
  • In Blueprints integration:
    • We have some reports about high memory use and performance issues caused by the Blueprints integration.
      While we are investigating the root cause of this, you can temporarily disable Blueprints support
      in File | Settings | Languages & Frameworks | C++ | Unreal Engine settings.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2020.1.3 update is here!

Here are some of the main highlights:

  • Experimental support for the Unreal Engine project model is introduced.
    • Enable it with File | Settings | Languages & Frameworks | C++ | Unreal Engine | [Experimental] Use Unreal Engine project model.
    • When opening a solution in this mode, Rider will take the modules-structured information about defines, include paths,
      and (starting from UE 4.25) PCH force includes from UBT instead of the .vcxproj files.
    • This guarantees correct coding assistance (like code completion or navigation) for configurations other than the default (Development Editor | Win64).
  • Fixes for the RiderLink/UnrealLink plugins:
    • RiderLink is now installed into the Engine itself instead of a game project. During the installation process,
      the plugin will be built and put into the correct folder, and a progress bar now appears when installing the plugin.
    • An option was added to compile the game before starting PIE from Rider.
    • The plugin no longer breaks the compilation of Unreal Engine projects in Rider.
  • Debugger enhancements and fixes:
    • Debug session no longer freezes on stop. (This happened when the target process spawned another child process that was later detached.)
    • A bug when child members weren't shown for some values is now fixed.
    • Threads are now named automatically based on their entry-point function.
    • Debugger got significant performance improvements, many freezes and crashes were fixed.
    • Fixes for stepping issues in multithreaded code, fixes for floating point type variables and arguments, and much more.
  • Fixes for the "Navigate to the derived symbols" action and auto-import invoked on enum or typedef.
  • Fixes for the incorrect window autoscroll when typing and editor crash in some cases.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

  • Fixed a number of regression bugs that affected Vue.js users (WEB-47097, WEB-46293, WEB-36206, and WEB-47454).

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2020.1.4 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • Context menus in the Project view can now be opened if you're using a language pack (IDEA-242047).
  • Two problems causing the IDE to crash were solved (JBR-2489 and JBR-2377).

For more details, please see the release notes.

WebStorm 2019.3.5 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • The problem with v2019.3.4 refusing to start when the installation path contains non-ASCII characters (IDEA-235754)

For more details, please see the release notes.

WebStorm 2019.2.4 is now available!

Fixes and improvements:

  • Support for nullish coalescing in TypeScript (WEB-41494)
  • Faster completion for Vue.js tags and attributes (WEB-41087)
  • Creating new projects now works with Vue CLI v4.0 (WEB-40757)
  • WebStorm now again uses a regular Open File dialog on macOS Catalina

WebStorm 2019.1.4 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • Several problems and performance issues when working with Angular projects were fixed
    (WEB-39587, WEB-39085, WEB-39115, WEB-39460, and more)
  • It's now again possible to use the detached editor on macOS (IDEA-189984)
  • The IDE no longer loses focus after pressing Esc in the Find in Path dialog (IDEA-215107)
  • Problem with adding braces in the attribute value in CoffeeScript was fixed (WEB-39059)

WebStorm 2018.3.6 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • The problem with running some tests using Jest 24+ was fixed (WEB-37680)
  • Completion after new in TypeScript (WEB-36511)
  • Curly braces in Angular templates are now closed automatically (WEB-37540)
  • Stability improvements from the IntelliJ platform

WebStorm 2018.2.8 is now available!

This update brings stability improvements from the IntelliJ platform.

A hotfix release for the third public EAP of Writerside is out!

This version contains fixes for the new PDF export feature, which was introduced in 233.14272.

Writerside 2023.2 EAP #2 is now available!

Most notable changes:

  • Support for PlantUML diagrams
  • Paste images into the editor from the clipboard
  • API docs: Markdown in object descriptions, references to objects and parameters, multiple <sample> elements
  • MD import: first imported topic becomes the home page, all files are selected for import by default
  • Better error reporting in the build log
  • Support for non-latin characters

For a full list of new features, improvements, and fixes, see What's new in 232.10275.
